message_1: If cos(x) = 0.5, what is the value of x in radians when considering the inverse function of cosine (arccos)?
message_2:
When cos(x) = 0.5, the value of x in radians can be found using the inverse function of cosine (arccos). 

x = arccos(0.5)

x = π/3 or 60° in radians.

So, x = π/3 radians.
